definition: to be the parent of (a child)
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: He and his wife have two adult sons.
sentences.chinese: 他与妻子育有两个儿子，都已成年。
他们育有一个儿子，鲁卡。

sentences.english: Their son and daughter were 13 and 11.
sentences.chinese: 他们共同育有一子一女，分别为13岁和11岁。

sentences.english: They have a lovely family with three children.
sentences.chinese: 他们家庭美满，育有一子二女。

sentences.english: According to reports, Love Story Bruni rich with ex-boyfriend have a son.
sentences.chinese: 据介绍，布鲁尼情史丰富，与前男友育有一子。

sentences.english: They had two children, Jesse Edwards and Mary.
sentences.chinese: 他们育有玛丽和杰西爱得沃兹两个子女。

sentences.english: They have one upped McD's which I love.
sentences.chinese: 他们育有一调升麦当劳的，我喜欢。

sentences.english: Biden remarried in 1977, a union that produced a daughter.
sentences.chinese: 拜登于1977年再婚，育有一女。

sentences.english: Meryl Streep got married in 1978 and has a son and three daughters.
sentences.chinese: 梅丽尔斯特里普于1978年结婚，育有一子三女。

sentences.english: They have four children, including an adopted daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他们育有4个子女，包括一个养女。

sentences.english: Made with a failed marriages, benevolence, daughters.
sentences.chinese: 立仁婚姻失败，育有一女。

sentences.english: After a successful vasectomy a man isn't able to father a child.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功后，男人就不能育有后代了。

sentences.english: Rajiv and Sonia had a son and a daughter.
sentences.chinese: 拉吉夫和索尼娅育有一子一女。

sentences.english: Rosenfeld had two children, Allison and Carol, with her late husband, Phillip.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯菲尔德与菲利普育有两个孩子，埃里森和卡罗。

sentences.english: Twin-bearing moms also had slightly shorter time spans between having children.
sentences.chinese: 育有双胞胎的母亲生育孩子的时间跨度上也稍短。

definition: to tie the knot (idiom)/to get married
at the knee (in reference to children)/(salutation used in letters to parents or grandparents)
to give birth to a child or children
